contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox waterfall | name = Sutherland Falls | photo = Sutherland Falls.jpg | photo_caption = | location = [[Fiordland]], [[New Zealand]], {{coord|44|48|.8028|S|167|43|48.76|E|type:mountain_region:NZ}} | type = Tiered | height = 581m | height_longest = 248m | number_drops = 3 | average_flow = 11 m3/s | world_rank = }} '''Sutherland Falls''' is a [[waterfall]] near [[Milford Sound]] in [[New Zealand]]'s [[South Island]]. At 580 metres (1,904 feet) the falls were long believed to be the tallest [[waterfall]] in [[New Zealand]]. However, [[Browne Falls]] cascades 843 metres (2,766 feet) down a mountainside in [[Doubtful Sound]], leading some to view that as the tallest.<ref>Jock Phillips. [http://www.teara.govt.nz/en/waterfalls/1 Waterfalls - A land of waterfalls], ''Te Ara - the Encyclopedia of New Zealand'', Ministry for Culture and Heritage. ISBN 978-0-478-18451-8. Updated 1 March 2009. Retrieved 2 September 2010.</ref> Water falls in three cascades, the upper is 229 m tall, middle - 248 m, lower - 103 m tall. Vertical fall of 580 m is made over 480 m of horizontal distance, thus the mean grade of falls is approximately 56 degrees.<ref name=wondermondo>{{Cite web|url=http://www.wondermondo.com/Countries/Au/NZ/Southland/Sutherland.htm|title=Sutherland Falls|publisher=Wondermondo}}</ref> The base of Sutherland Falls is a 90 minutes (return) walk from Quintin Public Shelter on the [[Milford Track]].<ref>[http://www.doc.govt.nz/parks-and-recreation/tracks-and-walks/fiordland/northern-fiordland/milford-track/track-description/ Milford Track - Track description], New Zealand Department of Conservation. Retrieved 19 May 2011.</ref> == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.world-of-waterfalls.com/new-zealand-sutherland-falls.html World of Waterfalls: Sutherland Falls] [[Category:Waterfalls of New Zealand]] [[Category:Fiordland]] [[Category:Geography of the Southland Region]] [[Category:Tiered waterfalls]] {{Waterfall-stub}} {{Southland-geo-stub}}
